title: Copying a specific object should not require "listing" permissions
body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
> rclone v1.32
> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
> macos El Capitan
> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
> S3-compatible
> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

I would like copy an object that I have the full URL to, but I do not otherwise have permissions in the bucket.

```
rclone -v --dump-headers  copy example:tools/update.sh /tmp/update.sh
```

This HEADs the object update.sh just fine, but then it tries to do a listing of the "tools" bucket, which I don't have permission to do, and the copy fails.

The listing seems unnecessary. Ideally rclone would either not do the listing, or ignore any errors and just copy the object.

> A log from the command with the `-v` flag (eg output from `rclone -v copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
> 
> ```
> 2016/08/09 19:34:56 rclone: Version "v1.32" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-v" "--dump-headers" "copy" "example:tools/update.sh" "/tmp/update.sh"]
> 2016/08/09 19:34:56 example: Using v2 auth
> 2016/08/09 19:34:56 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
> 2016/08/09 19:34:56 HTTP REQUEST
> 2016/08/09 19:34:56 HEAD /tools/update.sh HTTP/1.1
> Host: support.example.com
> User-Agent: rclone/v1.32
> Authorization: AWS 6bbfc19e5f901061805cce3fa77f18ff:kivrpkHoVolMQDz/U5QOyMbc2pM=
> Date: Wed, 10 Aug 2016 00:34:56 UTC
> ```
